basics.name: John Noonan
basics.label: Creative Technologist
basics.summary: I contribute to amazing experiences by creating tools, applications, research, art, and interactive media.

work.name: HUSH
work.summary: Working on projects ranging from interactive site specific apps, procedural animation systems, a VR previsualization tool, to a machine learning pipeline to process terrabytes of video and much more.
highlights: Contributing to concepting, scoping, R&D, design, and production.
Serving as technical lead on permant installations and popups through deployment.
Using tools such as TouchDesigner, openFrameworks, Unity/Unreal, Cinder, Spark AR, Processing, After Effects, and more.

work.name: Blue Sky Studios
work.summary: Used machine learning to create a program that estimates final shot render time without doing test renders.
highlights: The program identifies problematic shots before render time so they can be optimized, gives an estimate on the total time to render the shot, and allows for render TDs to better allocate their time.
Implemented in Python, using scikit-learn to create a model trained on historic film render data.

work.name: MARQ
work.summary: Metaliteracy Augmented Reality Quest (MARQ) is a research project at RPI led by Dr. Spina-Caza. The goal of the project is to teach new students how to use the library and conduct quality research while also teaching the history of RPI.
highlights: Worked in a team of professors and other students to create an augmented reality game.
Served as a game designer and sole developer. The android game is implemented using Unity and Vuforia.
Created a functional game demo to show off key aspects and ideas of the project.

work.name: Monadnock Media Inc
work.summary: I Worked in a team to create a group interactive light sculpture composed of canvas with thousands of LEDs controlled by user movement. It is installed as the center piece in the Mississippi Civil Rights Museum.
highlights: Using the Kinect API, Java, Processing library, and JSON, I designed and implemented multiple gesture interactive animations displayed on the sculpture along with real-time GUIs used to tune parameters.
Created a GUI to interactively control the shader based blending of layers of animation and to display the blended animation on a 3D model of the sculpture for testing and look development purposes.

work.name: UMass Fungal Comparative Genomics Lab
work.summary: Created a custom interactive NCBI BLAST query platform for Dr. Li-Jun Maâ€™s research lab with the purpose of simplifying gene sequencing query practices.
highlights: Converted command-line tools into more usable web-based ones that present the results in an easy to handle format.
Utilized Python, HTML/CSS, and basic JavaScript. The program is currently being used as a tool for Fusarium research.
